title: Early Childhood Development Support
banerDescription: Prepare yourself for professional support of children at risk of developmental disorders from the moment of disability detection until the start of compulsory education.
description:
• Individuals qualified to teach subjects or conduct classes but lacking preparation in special education
  • Individuals with preparation in special education who want to obtain additional preparation in special education
  • Individuals interested in working in early childhood development support
description2: Studies in special education with a specialization in "Early Childhood Development Support" prepare students for professional organization of early and systematic assistance to children at risk of developmental disorders from the moment of disability detection until the start of compulsory education.
description3: The aim of the studies is to prepare highly qualified staff for early childhood development support and early therapeutic intervention in integrated kindergartens, institutions, foundations, and associations implementing tasks within the framework of Early Childhood Development Support (ECDS) and psychological and pedagogical counseling centers.
description4: Graduates receive qualifications that prepare them to conduct classes within the framework of early childhood development support as special educators appropriate to the type of child's disability in institutions organizing early support.

topics.title: Elements of clinical psychology and psychopathology
Basics of neuropsychology - Anatomy and physiology of the nervous system with elements of neurology
Childhood diseases and chronic diseases in children
Early support of child language development
Methodology of early development support for children with autism spectrum
Methodology of sensory stimulation and integration
Methods and techniques of pedagogical therapy
Dyspraxia and other motor function developmental disorders in children
Eating disorders, tics, and obsessive-compulsive disorders in children
Psychosocial aspects of rehabilitation for children with dysfunctions

faculty: Classes are conducted by experienced practitioners in the field of early childhood development support, special education, and psychology.
practices:
• Internship I covers 60 hours and is carried out in semester 1.
  • Internship module II covers 120 hours and is carried out in semester 3.
  • Internships can be carried out in early development support centers, specialized counseling centers, and educational institutions implementing ECDS.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes is based on activity during classes, completion of individual modules, implementation of internships, and preparation of a diploma thesis.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Early childhood development support specialists
  • Special educators in educational and therapeutic institutions
  • Consultants in psychological and pedagogical counseling centers
  • Employees of rehabilitation and therapeutic centers
  • Therapists in foundations and associations implementing tasks within the framework of ECDS
invite: Gain the qualifications and skills necessary for professional support of the youngest children at risk of developmental disorders.
